activities.loc: Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level Hearing Room - LC300

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carl A Rogers-Irish

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Introduce Defendant's Statements, by the State.
of Intent to Introduce 911 Recordings, by the State.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim L.H. (person, property, residence or family), A.C.H. or contact with shared children.  Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:51 PM Defendant Carl A Rogers-Irish appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter appeared by video for Carl A Rogers-Irish.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. State moves to dismiss both counts and gives statement as to why. 
BTC: Court denies motion to dismiss.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
